Scraped from: https://finance.vanderbilt.edu/travel/
Date scraped: 2025-02-17 02:45:14

Finance Home Purchasing & Payment Services Travel Vanderbilt University Travel Vanderbilt’s travel agency of record is World Travel Service (WTS). Their dedicated professionals will help faculty and staff with travel needs by providing personalized support via phone or email. Vanderbilt employees must use World Travel Service to book business travel. Employees may book directly with an agent or through the Concur online booking tool . World Travel is fully integrated with the Concur online travel booking tool. Please contact a World Travel agent when making complex domestic air or any international air reservations, and when changing existing, ticketed reservations. Think you've found a lower fare? World Travel Service has a price match guarantee on identical U.S. Domestic flights. We'll match the fare or pay the difference. Just provide a screen-shot or verification in real-time, same day and email it to a World Travel agent. Consolidator and auction websites not included. Please click here to download the low domestic fare guarantee. World Travel Agent Assistance: During business hours (7:00am-5:00pm CST) dial (877) 271-9258 or email vanderbilt.travel@worldtrav.com After business hours or for ticketing emergencies dial (877) 271-9258

. Login Assistance: Email travel@vanderbilt.edu Concur Travel Technical Support: Email online@worldtrav.com Travel Policy and Booking Questions: Email Travel@vanderbilt.edu Airfare Pricing Comparison Expense Reporting FAQ Ground Transportation Group Travel Guest Travel Coordinators Hotels (Vanderbilt Partnered) International Travel Lost Airfare Receipt Nashville International Airport Newsletter Plan Your Travel Vanderbilt Incident Response for Travel(VIRT) Visit the Vanderbilt Global Safety website for information regarding what to expect when traveling Visit the Vanderbilt International and Domestic Travel & Benefits FAQ s for information regarding healthcare and other benefits while traveling Visit the Vanderbilt Global Safety website for information regarding what to expect when traveling Visit the Vanderbilt International and Domestic Travel & Benefits FAQ s for information regarding healthcare and other benefits while traveling Assign a Travel Assistant Global Entry & TSA Pre-Check Guest Travel Reservations Updating Profile Global Education Office Green Transportation Initiatives and Tips - SustainVU Office of Active Citizenship and Service for Student Organizations International Security Provider Vanderbilt Export Compliance International Travel Advisories and Related Information Global Entry TSA - Travel Security Administration Travel Warnings - Issued by US Dept of State US Department of State, Bureau of Consular Affairs

Finance Home Financial Operations and Planning Financial Operations and Planning ePBCS Login Capital Plan guidance Capital Project NPV Model Template Style guide for variance explanations ePBCS resources How to download SmartView PBCS Data Intersections Financials Period Dimension Breakdown Financials Plan Element Dimension Breakdown How to download SmartView PBCS Data Intersections Financials Period Dimension Breakdown Financials Plan Element Dimension Breakdown The Business of VU program began in 2017 as a course for faculty, staff, and students to learn about the business operations of the university and higher education as a whole. A cohort of about 35 participants are carefully selected through an application process. Participants are selected based on interest level, background of experience, and commitment to Vanderbilt University. They learn from a diverse set of presenters who are among the most integral in making Vanderbilt a university rooted in excellence. Topics include a higher education overview, VU governance, global impacts on higher education, the economics of Vanderbilt, and many more. Applications for the Fall 2024 cohort are available here . Nomination forms for the Fall 2024 cohort are available here . The application period closes April 30, 2024

. Applications for the Fall 2024 cohort are available here . Nomination forms for the Fall 2024 cohort are available here . The application period closes April 30, 2024. Contact Financial Operations & Planning For Business of VU questions: Email BusinessofVU@vanderbilt.edu For budgeting & forecasting questions: Email vufpa@vanderbilt.edu For ESA & NSBA questions: Email vu-esa_nsba@vanderbilt.edu

Scraped from: https://finance.vanderbilt.edu/researchfinance/
Date scraped: 2025-02-17 02:45:16

Finance Home Research Finance Home Vanderbilt Research Finance Welcome to the Vanderbilt University Research Finance home page. Primary functions of Research Finance include:  post-award financial administration related to sponsored programs within the University, and development and negotiation of fringe benefit and facilities and administrative cost rates for the University. financial oversight of VU Core Facilities Research Finance is a service-oriented team dedicated to Vanderbilt University’s research and academic missions. We are committed to excellence in performing functions that support both sponsored projects and cost accounting, which promote and ensure the accountability of sponsored funds. Through professionalism, effective communication and responsive service, we contribute to Vanderbilt’s continuing success as a top research institution.
================================================================================

Date scraped: 2025-02-17 02:45:19

Finance Home Purchasing & Payment Services Purchasing Services Purchasing Services Purchasing Services purchases the supplies, equipment and services which support the educational and research missions at Vanderbilt University. Our mission is to cooperatively develop and execute sourcing strategies products and services that meet or exceed university requirements and to perform our services to the highest ethical and professional standards. Our team is committed to promoting small, disadvantaged and minority owned businesses through our supplier diversity program and supports the university's commitments to environmental responsibility and outreach to the local business community. General Purchasing Policy Contractor Background Check Policy Independent Contractor Policy Supplier Diversity & Small Businesses Federal PI Resources for Small Business Plans Green Purchasing Export Compliance Federally Debarred Suppliers Fleet Management Program Independent Contractors / External Consultants (Professional Services) Lease Analysis Form Purchase Order Terms and Conditions Supplier Selection Justification Form New Supplier Information Preferred Suppliers Procurement Contract Responsibilities Request for Proposal Opportunities Contact Purchasing Services For general Purchasing Services questions: Email PurchasingServices@vanderbilt.edu.

Scraped from: https://finance.vanderbilt.edu/stuaccts/
Date scraped: 2025-02-17 02:45:24

Student Accounts  The Office of Student Accounts is the centralized billing and collection point for student accounts. The primary function of the Student Accounts office is to issue bills, receive payments and provide information to help understand the aspects of a Vanderbilt account. Student Accounts posts miscellaneous charges and credits by the department from which they originate. All Vanderbilt University students will be required to acknowledge the terms and conditions of an online Student Account Agreement form when logging into the YES portal. Please note that the acceptance of these terms and conditions is mandatory, and will be required on an annual basis. Failure to agree to these terms will prevent access to the YES landing page. Once the terms have been accepted, a copy of the most recently accepted form will be available for viewing and printing within the YES portal. Please read these terms and conditions carefully. A separate stand-alone document exists in order to add a guarantor(s) to an individual student account. Click here to download a copy of the new Guarantor Authorization and Agreement form. Please note that this paper document will be required in order to disclose any financial information to anyone other than the student and existing guarantors. Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions or concerns. Thank you! IMPORTANT DATES AND NEWS The quickest and most secure method of payment remains online via the Student Billing Portal

. Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions or concerns. Thank you! IMPORTANT DATES AND NEWS The quickest and most secure method of payment remains online via the Student Billing Portal. We understand that transaction fees are unfavorable; therefore, there is no fee for ACH/e-check payments. A transaction fee will be charged for all online debit and credit card transactions. Initial Spring 2025 e-bills will be available on December 1, 2024 and due by December 31, 2024. Invoices are created at the beginning of each month If other payers are not set up in the system, these individuals may not receive notification of balances due or have access to make payments in our system. To add an “Other Payer”, please follow the simple instructions on the Student E-Bill Information page. Additional payers will also have the ability to enroll in the Spring 2025 Vandy Plan, an interest-free monthly installment option available for enrollment, beginning October 1st, 2024. There is no Vandy Plan for the Summer 2024 semester. If other payers are not set up in the system, these individuals may not receive notification of balances due or have access to make payments in our system. To add an “Other Payer”, please follow the simple instructions on the Student E-Bill Information page. Additional payers will also have the ability to enroll in the Spring 2025 Vandy Plan, an interest-free monthly installment option available for enrollment, beginning October 1st, 2024

. Additional payers will also have the ability to enroll in the Spring 2025 Vandy Plan, an interest-free monthly installment option available for enrollment, beginning October 1st, 2024. There is no Vandy Plan for the Summer 2024 semester. As a reminder, the Transact online payment system is down for maintenance at 6 p.m. Central Time the last day of each month and will then reopen at 6 a.m.the next business day. 1098-T forms may be found on the Student Accounts link from the student's YES landing page . Form 1098-T reports amounts paid for qualified tuition and scholarships and grants processed in the tax year for students enrolled in courses at Vanderbilt University for which they receive academic credit. Vanderbilt does not issue a 1098-T form if the student is enrolled in not-for-credit courses. To prevent any delays or penalties with regards to your 1098-T, be sure you have a valid SSN on file with the university. For frequently asked 1098T questions click here . Protecting your privacy

Finance Home Treasury Treasury Home Vanderbilt University Treasury Department Mission: To serve as stewards of the university's working capital assets and debt, and to provide treasury services and solutions to the university in a professional and client-centered manner, thereby facilitating Vanderbilt's broader mission of worldwide leadership in scholarship and research.
